sait.mls.problemdomain.clientale

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • sait.mls.problemdomain.clientale.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class Description: A Client object is a representation of client data for the SAIT MLS. The client is represented by a client id, last name, first name, address, postal code, phone number, client type and active record status.
    Version:
    February 4, 2019
    Author:
    dwatson, Nick Hamnett
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private boolean active
      Stores the active status of this record in the random access file of clients.
      private java.lang.String address
      Stores the client's current address as string of maximum size of 50 characters.
      private long clientID
      Stores the client membership id number.
      private char clientType
      Stores the client type for this client as to whether they are in the market of residential (R), commercial (C) or both (B).
      private java.lang.String firstName
      Stores the client's first name as string of maximum size of 20 characters.
      private java.lang.String lastName
      Stores the client's last name as string of maximum size of 20 characters.
      private java.lang.String phoneNumber
      Stores the client's current phone number as string of maximum size of 12 characters in the following format 403-222-5555.
      private java.lang.String postalCode
      Stores the client's current postal code as string of maximum size of 7 characters in the following format A9A 9A9.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      static int SIZE
      Constant to store the number of bytes required to store a client object in a Random Access File.

      Creates an instance of this object with a specified list of initial values.
      Client(java.lang.String line)
      Creates an instance of a Client object with a specified list of initial values based on the string input.

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        private static final long serialVersionUID
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SIZE

        public static final int SIZE
        Constant to store the number of bytes required to store a client object in a Random Access File.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • clientID

        private long clientID
        Stores the client membership id number. Uniquely identifies the client with long integer value and is system generated value.

      • lastName

        private java.lang.String lastName
        Stores the client's last name as string of maximum size of 20 characters.

      • firstName

        private java.lang.String firstName
        Stores the client's first name as string of maximum size of 20 characters.

      • address

        private java.lang.String address
        Stores the client's current address as string of maximum size of 50 characters.

      • postalCode

        private java.lang.String postalCode
        Stores the client's current postal code as string of maximum size of 7 characters in the following format A9A 9A9.

      • phoneNumber

        private java.lang.String phoneNumber
        Stores the client's current phone number as string of maximum size of 12 characters in the following format 403-222-5555.

      • active

        private boolean active
        Stores the active status of this record in the random access file of clients. If the client's active status holds true the client is active. If client's active status is false then the client's record is deleted or inactive.

      • clientType

        private char clientType
        Stores the client type for this client as to whether they are in the market of residential (R), commercial (C) or both (B).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        Creates an instance of this object with default values.

      • Client

        public Client(long id,
              java.lang.String firstName,
              java.lang.String lastName,
              java.lang.String address,
              java.lang.String postalCode,
              java.lang.String phoneNumber,
              char clientType)
       throws InvalidPhoneNumberException,
              InvalidPostalCodeException,
              InvalidClientTypeException
        Creates an instance of this object with a specified list of initial values.
        Parameters:
        id - The client's membership number.
        firstName - The client's first name.
        lastName - The client's last name.
        address - The client's current address.
        postalCode - The client's current postal code.
        phoneNumber - The client's current phone number.
        clientType - The client's type R = residential, C = commercial and B = both.
        Throws:
        InvalidPostalCodeException - Is thrown when the format of the postal code is not the following: A9A 9A9
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - Is thrown when the format of the phone number is not the following: 403-222-5555
        InvalidClientTypeException - Thrown if client type is not R (residential), C (commercial), or B (both).

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String line)
       throws InvalidPhoneNumberException,
              InvalidPostalCodeException,
              InvalidClientTypeException
        Creates an instance of a Client object with a specified list of initial values based on the string input.
        Parameters:
        line - Contains a complete set of client information.
        Throws:
        InvalidPostalCodeException - Is thrown when the format of the postal code is not the following: A9A 9A9
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - Is thrown when the format of the phone number is not the following: 403-222-5555
        InvalidClientTypeException - Thrown if client type is not R (residential), C (commercial), or B (both).

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Method defines how one client is compared to another client to determine if the clients are equal. The comparison is determined using the client's id value.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A value of true is returned if both clients have the same id and false if they don't.

      • validatePostalCode

        private void validatePostalCode(java.lang.String pc)
                         throws InvalidPostalCodeException
        Method to validate the Postal Code is in the correct format of A9A 9A9 and if it is not then the method throws an InvalidPostalCodeException.
        Parameters:
        pc - the postal code to validate.
        Throws:
        InvalidPostalCodeException - if the postal code format is incorrect.

      • validatePhoneNumber

        private void validatePhoneNumber(java.lang.String pn)
                          throws InvalidPhoneNumberException
        Method to validate the Phone Number is in the correct format of 111-111-1111 and if it is not then the method throws an InvalidPhoneNumberException.
        Parameters:
        pn - the phone number to validate.
        Throws:
        InvalidPhoneNumberException - if the phone number format is incorrect.
